Theophilus mentions painting upon wall, ‘⁶ in muro,” and upon ceiling or plaster work, “in laqueari.'’ In the former style par- ticular colours are to be used, mixed with lime to make them bind, “propter firmitatem,'' chap. 16. This was the Byzantine mode of painting upon walls, “in humidO,” and is quite a dif- ferent process from that known by the name of “ fresco‚'' which was of Italian invention.
